alert.note: Alert for Western Kenai Peninsula (Alaska) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Winter Weather Advisory issued January 30 at 2:54AM AKST until January 30 at 12:00PM AKST by NWS Anchorage
info.description: ...WINTER WEATHER ADVISORY REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL NOON AKST TODAY... * WHAT...Snow and blowing snow. Visibility reduced to one half mile or less at times. Additional snow accumulations of 1 to 3 inches, highest amounts in Homer. South to southwest winds gusting as high as 40 mph. * WHERE...Ninilchik south to Kachemak Bay, including Homer and Seldovia. * WHEN...Until noon AKST Today. * IMPACTS...Travel will be hazardous. Blowing snow will significant reduce visibility. The cold wind chills as low as 30 below zero could cause frostbite on exposed skin in as little as 30 minutes. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS...Winds will very slowly diminish today, leading to improving visibility. Snow showers will likely linger all the way into the evening.
info.instruction: Slow down and use caution while traveling. For the latest road conditions call 5 1 1 or visit 511.alaska.gov.
